reviews.review_msg: Pamela is super caring. Took this course last semester and it was great. She definitely deserves these 5/5 stars.

Maureen seems like a very sweet lady, but I would not take a course with her again. She rarely replies to emails, criteria for assignments is unclear, and marks are docked for the smallest things (which again, are not clearly outlined in criteria). You're required to read the textbook in its entirety - I had a hard time keeping up in this course.

For the 315 online course, it was my first online class at SFU so I made sure I never fell behind (in fact ahead for once). As long as you put effort into the assignments every week, the final shouldn't be as intimidating. I actually got a really good mark this way... The final I needed the 3hr. Who cares about instructor not being present?

People shouldn't blame her this much because SFU just puts a prof's name on SIS to make the course look legitimate & it's not the prof's responsibility to teach an online class.. If you have any course to take with her, take it IN-CLASS. She is kind and helpful. You will hear a lot of interesting information relevant to Special Education.

Was interested in the course prior to taking it. In the end it was of little use when it came to application in a teaching setting. EASY marking by the TA and ZERO input/interaction with Prof until she clarified the expectation of the exam 48 hours before writing the final. Prof was not available at exam time for clarification on an exam question.

I took this course via DE and it is a lot of work for 3 credits. There's a discrepancy between readings and assignments. Don't expect to interact with the instructor too much as most feedback will be from the TA. I have taken a course with Maureen prior and she is a very sweet lady. Despite the negative ratings, I would definitely recommend her.

Completely disorganized course, textbook, course material and assignments do not align. Group discussions often changed last minute due to content not actually working, the assignment deadlines were unorganized and overall it was poorly administrated. Content itself was useless, in spite of my high interest in the subject.

A totally disorganized course lacking cohesion. Assignments oftentimes not corresponding assigned readings. Late responses and marking from our TA. The textbook was alright, although theories in it seemed quite outdated.

This course (dist ed.) seems easy until you go into the final. The final is not at all related to the study questions or learning objectives. They are based on very detailed facts in the textbooks. AVOID!

I am a 4th year student and i took this class, possibly one of the hardest classes iv ever taken. avoid it like the plauge. you only deal with the TA. The assingments arnt to bad. i had an A going into the final.. but the final is nothing like the class!! very very specific questions avoid it if you care at all about your GPA

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU DON'T HAVE TO!  There is a lot of reading and information to remember!  It's difficult!  The instructions on assignment are contradictory and confusing.  Took it online, never even heard from the Prof., and TA is not very good...
The Educ315 Dist Ed course is not an easy course! There are tons of assignments and very heavy readings. But if you keep up with the course and put in the time, you will be fine.

Didn't directly associate with Maureen Hoskyn, just the ta but the class, via distance ed.- very heavy work load!  an assignment due every single week for the first month and half.  Assignments at time did not even pertain to course!  Way too many readings and work for an undergrad course.
